intro: Cynoglossum erysimifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rounded leaves and small, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It is often found in open meadows and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
